text: "Pearly-Dewdrops' Drops" is a single by Scottish post-punk band Cocteau Twins, taken from their 1984 EP The Spangle Maker. The song was written by Cocteau Twins, and recorded at Rooster Studios in London. It was their highest- charting single, peaking at No. 29 on the UK Singles Chart and No. 1 on the UK Indie Chart. ==In popular culture== The song was used on the soundtrack of the 2012 film The Perks of Being a Wallflower. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (1984) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- |- !scope="row" |- |} ==References== Category:1984 singles Category:1984 songs Category:Cocteau Twins songs Category:4AD singles Category:UK Independent Singles Chart number-one singles
